record.field: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

footnotes.footnote: Data refer to the settled population based on the 1979 Population Census and the latest household prelisting. The refugees of Afghanistan in Iran, Pakistan, and an estimated 1.5 million nomads, are not included.
Population statistics are compiled from registers.
Projections based on the 2010 Population and Housing Census.
These data have been randomly rounded to protect confidentiality. Individual figures may not add up to totals, and values for the same data may vary in different tables.
Including population in off-shore, migratory and shipping.
Based on the results of the 2011 Population Census.
Data refer to national projections.
Data refer to annual average population.
Projections based on the 2013 Population Census.
Data based on the 2010 Population Census.
Data refer to projected figures based on the Population and Housing Census 2005 (district projection).
Data based on the 2011 Census.

Data include persons in remote areas, military personnel outside the country, merchant seamen at sea, civilian seasonal workers outside the country, and other civilians outside the country, and exclude nomads, foreign military, civilian aliens temporarily in the country, transients on ships and Indian jungle population.

To ensure confidentiality, the values, including totals are randomly rounded either up or down to a multiple of '5' or '10.' As a result, when these data are summed or grouped, the total value may not match the individual values since totals and sub-totals are independently rounded. Similarly, percentages, which are calculated on rounded data, may not necessarily add up to 100%.
Preliminary postcensal estimates.
Data are estimates from sample enquiry.

Data refer to Hong Kong resident population at the census moment, which covers usual residents and mobile residents. Usual residents refer to two categories of people: (1) Hong Kong permanent residents who had stayed in Hong Kong for at least three months during the six months before or for at least three months during the six months after the census moment, regardless of whether they were in Hong Kong or not at the census moment; and (2) Hong Kong non-permanent residents who were in Hong Kong at the census moment. Mobile Residents, they are Hong Kong permanent residents who had stayed in Hong Kong for at least one month but less than three months during the six months before or for at least one month but less than three months during the six months after the census moment, regardless of whether they were in Hong Kong or not at the census moment.

Population By-census is conducted between two population censuses, and sampling method was adopted to select 29,421 housing units in Macao for enumeration, and the unit of observation was individuals residing in these units.
Data are revised projections taking into consideration also the results of the 2005 census.
Excluding Niue, shown separately, which is part of Cook Islands, but because of remoteness is administered separately.
Based on the national household survey of 2016.
Projections based on the 2014 Population Census.
Postcensal estimates.
Data refer to government controlled areas.
Excluding Faeroe Islands and Greenland shown separately, if available.
Excludes nomadic Indian tribes.
Estimates or projections based on the 2007 Population Census.
Estimates considering also the results of the 2007 Population Census.
Excluding Åland Islands.
Excluding diplomatic personnel outside the country and including members of alien armed forces not living in military camps and foreign diplomatic personnel not living in embassies or consulates.
Based on the results of the 2014 Population Census.
Excluding data for Saint Barthélémy and Saint Martin.
Including armed forces stationed in the area.
Data refer to usually resident population.
Data refer to registered resident population.
Data are based on the publication: "Indonesia Population Projection 2010-2035"
Data refer to the Iranian Year which begins on 21 March and ends on 20 March of the following year.
Includes data for East Jerusalem and Israeli residents in certain other territories under occupation by Israeli military forces since June 1967.
Because of rounding, totals are not in all cases the sum of the respective components.
Excluding diplomatic personnel outside the country and foreign military and civilian personnel and their dependants stationed in the area.
Estimates based on the complete counts of the 2015 Population Census
Excluding data for Jordanian territory under occupation since June 1967 by Israeli military forces.
Post-censal estimates based on the 2009 Population Census.
Estimates based on the results of 2015 population census.
Estimates based on the adjusted results of the Population and Housing Census of 2010.
Data refer to resident Maldivian population.
Including civilian nationals temporarily outside the country.
Excludes the islands of St. Brandon and Agalega.
Data refer to resident population only.
Projections based on the results of national survey on population and health conducted between 2010 and 2011, and especially population and housing census 2014.
Data refer to projections based on the 2011 Population Census.
Projections based on the 2012 Population and Housing Census.
Data are projections based on the 2006 Population Census.
Data refer to registered population data from Royal Oman Police.
Estimates are prepared by the Secretariat of the Pacific Community based on the last population and housing census.
Estimates or projections considering also the results of the 2012 Population Census.
Data refer to total resident population, Saint Helenian and other nationalities.
Data refer to Saint Helenian resident population.
Excludes data for Kosovo and Metohia.
Data refer to resident population which comprises Singapore citizens and permanent residents.
Data exclude residents who have been away from Singapore for a continuous period of 12 months or longer as at the reference date.
Data refer to total population, which comprises Singapore residents and non-residents.
Data refer to legal resident population.
Data based on Address Based Population Registration System.
The Government of Ukraine has informed the United Nations that it is not in a position to provide statistical data concerning the Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol.
Data include non-national population.
Excluding Channel Islands (Guernsey and Jersey) and Isle of Man, shown separately, if available.
Excluding U.S. Armed Forces overseas and civilian U.S. citizens whose usual place of residence is outside the United States.
Data are adjusted according to the results of the 2009 census and 2014 intercensus.
Projections based on the 2012 Population Census.
